snippet.title: Seal makes its way onto sport fields | Photos
snippet.content:
Seal makes its way onto sport fields | Photos
exit
A seal made its way onto the Churchill Park Sports Complex on a rainy Sunday morning. About 10am the animal was spotted relaxing at the soccer fields - seemingly oblivious to the attention it was causing.
Whether the seal was lost, exploring, or looking to join a soccer team, has not been confirmed. Churchill Park Sports Complex is adjacent to the North Esk River, for which the Bureau of Meteorology issued a minor flood alert.
Tasmania Police were notified of the soccer seal - and were on the scene. It is understood Tasmania Parks and Wildlife Service were working to relocate the seal. Launceston residents are familiar with stubborn seals in unusual places.
In December Tasmania Police spent .
The creature was spotted by residents atop a silver Toyota Camry. In front of onlookers, the animal leapt from the vehicle - leaving behind extensive damage, including a cracked windshield and dents in the car's frame. The Examiner's video of the seal in the car park also provided fodder for Launceston's comedians:
The story first appeared on .
